"Civility is not about abandoning our principles or even changing our beliefs," says David Bobb, "it is about a shared commitment to engage respectfully, even when we disagree, and to work together to find common solutions." David Bobb, President and CEO of the Bill of Rights Institute, offers insight into the challenges students face around civil discourse and ways towards improvement. The Bill of Rights Institute has worked with history and civics teachers over the past 25 years, gaining a network of over 80,000 educators. Teachers are continuously looking for ways to navigate political division in their classrooms. Read more, here  https://lnkd.in/en7wDXXg.

Students, Teachers, and Parents! Are you looking for ways to find and earn scholarships? ScholarshipGPS can help! Scholarship GPS is an online platform that helps students and parents learn how to find and earn scholarships. David Peterson helped his son receive $95,000 in college scholarships. He started Scholarships GPS to help families navigate the world of scholarships to secure debt-free college degrees. Learn more, here  https://lnkd.in/eNehVDV5 The Bill of Rights Institute is grateful for Scholarship GPS's donation towards MyImpact Challenge. Interested in learning more about MyImpact Challenge? Visit  https://lnkd.in/gagj58zD

#OTD 250 years ago, Patrick Henry stood before the Virginia Convention and delivered a spirited, rallying call to his fellow colonists to take a stand for independence. This speech has come to be known as the "Give me liberty, or give me death!" speech. Explore our Founders resource to learn more about Henry today!  https://lnkd.in/eczeKbR2

Civics for Everyone is a new initative aimed at improving the accessibility of BRI resources and tools for all students- regardless of their learning level, school budget, or zip code. With support from leading technology companies, disability advocacy groups, and foundations, this initiative will help ensure all students have access to a high-quality civic and history education. Watch the video with Justin Goldstein, CAE, Director of Corporate Relations  https://lnkd.in/eBqjm6Y2. Learn more about Civics for Everyone at  https://lnkd.in/eX8DHCFP.

How did Shermans March to the Sea support emancipation during the Civil War? In this episode of Scholar Talks, BRI Senior Fellow Tony Williams sits down with historian Bennett Parten to discuss themes from Somewhere Toward Freedom. They explore the intersection of military strategy and the fight for freedom, the choices enslaved individuals made, and the marchs lasting impact on Reconstruction. Watch now,  https://lnkd.in/eCeZQGbr.  #BRI  #BillofRightsInstitute  #ScholarTalk

The Bill of Rights Institute is honored to partner with Konica Minolta Business Solutions U. S. A., Inc. to support 50,000 civics and history students. Power of the Printed Word is a funding and printing initiative to enable BRI to provide pocket copies of the U. S. Constitution to teachers and students nationwide. We are extremely honored and proud to support The Bill of Rights Institute in their mission to drive high-quality civic education, and excited to help bring these important pieces of our history to students,  said Jason Dizzine, Vice President, Portfolio Management and Planning, Konica Minolta. Konica Minolta Business Solutions U. S. A. Inc.'s (Konica Minolta) journey started more than 150 years ago, with a vision to see and do things differently. To learn more about Konica Minolta and the partnership with the Bill of Rights Institute, visit  https://lnkd.in/e54jP73a.  #BillofRightsInstitute  #BRI  #PowerofthePrintedWord

📰 Konica Minolta and Bill of Rights Institute Partner to Support 50,000 Civics and History Students: Will Help Provide Pocket Constitutions to Classrooms Throughout the United States Read all about it:  https://ow.ly/IFva50VkvH4

The Honoring Service series explores civic virtue and responsibility by highlighting the service of our nations veterans. In this episode, former Army Aviator Dean Wegner joins Vice President of Civic Leadership Development Gerald Gangaram to reflect on his time at West Point, Army Ranger training and career in aviation. Wegners experiences taught him leadership skills, grit, and perseverance to overcome challenges, both in the Army and now as an entrepreneur. Wegner is the founder and CEO of Authentically American, an American-made premium apparel company. The heart of their mission is their passion for creating American jobs, which Wegner attributes to his calling to serve the nation. Watch the video, now  https://lnkd.in/exq6Kwnv Learn more about the Wright Brothers diligence in pioneering flight by exploring the lesson, It is a Fact Man Cant Fly: The Wright Brothers at Kitty Hawk and Diligence.  https://lnkd.in/etUF6QCW  #BillofRightsInstitute  #BRI  #HonoringService
